crises.name: Syria Humanitarian Crisis
crises.description: Over a decade of conflict has created one of the worst humanitarian crises of our time. More than 13 million people need humanitarian assistance, with millions displaced internally and as refugees in neighboring countries.

crises.name: Yemen Humanitarian Emergency
crises.description: Yemen faces the world's worst humanitarian crisis with over 21 million people in need. Widespread famine, disease outbreaks, and ongoing conflict have devastated the country's infrastructure and healthcare system.

crises.name: Sudan Armed Conflict
crises.description: Intense fighting between military factions has displaced millions and triggered a severe humanitarian emergency. Access to food, water, and medical care has become extremely limited for much of the population.

crises.name: Gaza Humanitarian Crisis
crises.description: Ongoing conflict has created catastrophic humanitarian conditions with severe shortages of food, water, medical supplies, and fuel. The healthcare system has been overwhelmed and millions face displacement.

crises.name: Ukraine Humanitarian Emergency
crises.description: The ongoing conflict has created Europe's largest displacement crisis since World War II. Millions have fled the country while those remaining face destruction of infrastructure, energy shortages, and ongoing danger.

crises.name: Afghanistan Humanitarian Crisis
crises.description: Afghanistan faces one of the world's most severe humanitarian emergencies with over half the population requiring assistance. Economic collapse, drought, and restricted rights have exacerbated food insecurity.

crises.name: DRC Eastern Conflict
crises.description: Armed conflict in eastern DRC has displaced millions and created severe food insecurity. Violence against civilians continues while disease outbreaks compound the humanitarian emergency.

crises.name: Ethiopia Tigray Crisis
crises.description: Though a peace agreement was signed, the humanitarian situation remains severe with millions in need of food assistance. Recovery efforts are underway but significant challenges persist.

crises.name: Somalia Drought & Famine
crises.description: Consecutive failed rainy seasons have pushed millions to the brink of famine. Combined with ongoing conflict and displacement, the humanitarian situation is extremely dire.

crises.name: Haiti Political Crisis
crises.description: Gang violence and political instability have paralyzed the country, with millions facing food insecurity and lack of access to healthcare. Displacement within the country has reached record levels.

crises.name: Myanmar Conflict
crises.description: Ongoing conflict following the military coup has displaced hundreds of thousands. The Rohingya crisis continues with limited prospects for return, while fighting spreads across the country.

crises.name: Pakistan Floods Recovery
crises.description: Recovery continues from the devastating 2022 floods that affected 33 million people. While waters have receded, millions remain displaced and infrastructure reconstruction is ongoing.

crises.name: Türkiye-Syria Earthquake Recovery
crises.description: The devastating 2023 earthquakes killed over 50,000 people and left millions homeless. Long-term recovery efforts continue with ongoing needs for shelter, healthcare, and livelihood support.

crises.name: Venezuela Refugee Crisis
crises.description: Over 7 million Venezuelans have fled the country due to economic collapse and political instability. Those remaining face severe shortages of food, medicine, and basic services.

crises.name: Sahel Food Crisis
crises.description: Conflict and climate change have pushed millions in the Sahel region into severe food insecurity. Displacement continues as violence spreads and agricultural production declines.

crises.name: Bangladesh Rohingya Refugees
crises.description: Over 900,000 Rohingya refugees remain in camps in Cox's Bazar with no prospect of safe return. The protracted crisis strains resources while refugees face limited opportunities.

crises.name: South Sudan Humanitarian Crisis
crises.description: Years of conflict have left South Sudan with one of the world's worst food crises. Flooding and economic instability compound the humanitarian emergency affecting millions.

crises.name: Morocco Earthquake Recovery
crises.description: The September 2023 earthquake in the Atlas Mountains killed nearly 3,000 people. Recovery efforts continue in remote villages with ongoing needs for shelter and infrastructure.

crises.name: Libya Floods Recovery
crises.description: The catastrophic flooding in Derna in September 2023 killed thousands and devastated the city. Recovery and reconstruction efforts continue with ongoing humanitarian needs.

crises.name: Central African Republic Crisis
crises.description: Ongoing armed conflict has displaced hundreds of thousands and left half the population in need of humanitarian assistance. Access to basic services remains severely limited.

crises.name: Malawi Cholera Outbreak
crises.description: One of Africa's worst cholera outbreaks in recent years has affected thousands. Response efforts continue with focus on water, sanitation, and healthcare access.

crises.name: Philippines Typhoon Response
crises.description: Regular typhoons continue to impact vulnerable communities. Ongoing recovery from recent storms while building resilience against future disasters remains a priority.

crises.name: Lebanon Economic Crisis
crises.description: Economic collapse combined with hosting 1.5 million Syrian refugees has created a severe humanitarian situation. Most of the population now lives below the poverty line.

crises.name: Nigeria Conflict & Food Crisis
crises.description: Conflict in the northeast and banditry in the northwest have displaced millions and created severe food insecurity. Economic challenges compound the humanitarian situation.

crises.name: Vanuatu Cyclone Recovery
crises.description: Twin cyclones in 2023 devastated the Pacific island nation, affecting most of the population. Recovery efforts continue with focus on shelter, water, and food security.

crises.name: Tonga Volcanic Eruption Recovery
crises.description: Recovery continues from the 2022 volcanic eruption and tsunami. Long-term rebuilding efforts focus on infrastructure and community resilience.

crises.name: Colombia Venezuelan Refugees
crises.description: Colombia hosts over 2 million Venezuelan refugees, straining resources and services. Integration efforts continue while new arrivals persist.

crises.name: Mozambique Conflict & Cyclones
crises.description: Insurgency in Cabo Delgado combined with recurring cyclones has displaced over a million people. Food insecurity and limited services affect millions more.

crises.name: Madagascar Food Crisis
crises.description: Recurring droughts in southern Madagascar have created severe food insecurity. Climate change continues to threaten agricultural production and livelihoods.

crises.name: East Africa Mpox Outbreak
crises.description: A new strain of mpox has been spreading rapidly in Central and East Africa. International response is scaling up to contain the outbreak and support affected communities.
